items.name: changeView(viewName)
items.description: Change current view type.

params.name: viewName
params.description: The new view name to change to. Available values are 'month', 'week', 'day'.

examples.code: // change to daily view calendar.changeView('day'); // change to weekly view calendar.changeView('week'); // change to monthly view calendar.changeView('month');

items.name: clear()
items.description: Delete all events and clear view

examples.code: calendar.clear();

items.name: createEvents(events)
items.description: Create events and render calendar.

params.name: events
params.description: list of EventObject

examples.code: calendar.createEvents([ { id: '1', calendarId: '1', title: 'my event', category: 'time', dueDateClass: '', start: '2018-01-18T22:30:00+09:00', end: '2018-01-19T02:30:00+09:00', }, { id: '2', calendarId: '1', title: 'second event', category: 'time', dueDateClass: '', start: '2018-01-18T17:30:00+09:00', end: '2018-01-19T17:31:00+09:00', }, ]);

items.name: deleteEvent(eventId, calendarId)
items.description: Delete an event.

params.name: eventId
params.description: event's id to delete

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The CalendarId of the event to delete

items.name: destroy()
items.description: Destroys the instance.

items.name: getDate()
items.description: Get current rendered date. (see TZDate for further information)

items.name: getDateRangeEnd()
items.description: End time of rendered date range. (see TZDate for further information)

items.name: getDateRangeStart()
items.description: Start time of rendered date range. (see TZDate for further information)

items.name: getElement(eventId, calendarId)
items.description: Get the DOM element of the event by event id and calendar id

params.name: eventId
params.description: ID of event

params.name: calendarId
params.description: calendarId of event

examples.code: const element = calendar.getElement(eventId, calendarId); console.log(element);

returns.description: event element if found or null

items.name: getEvent(eventId, calendarId)
items.description: Get an EventObject with event's id and calendar's id.

params.name: eventId
params.description: event's id

params.name: calendarId
params.description: calendar's id of the event

examples.code: const event = calendar.getEvent(eventId, calendarId); console.log(event.title);

returns.description: event. If the event can't be found, it returns null.

items.name: getOptions()
items.description: Get current options.

returns.description: The current options of the instance

items.name: getViewName()
items.description: Get current view name('day', 'week', 'month').

items.name: move(offset)
items.description: Move the rendered date to the next/prev range.

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset to move by.

examples.code: // Move to the next month in month view. calendar.move(1); // Move to the next year in month view. calendar.move(12); // Move to yesterday in day view. calendar.move(-1);

items.name: new CalendarCore(container, options)
items.description: CalendarCore class

params.name: container
params.description: container element or selector.

params.name: options
params.description: calendar options. For more information, see Calendar options in guide.

properties.name: defaultView
properties.description: Initial view type. Available values are: 'day', 'week', 'month'.

properties.name: useFormPopup
properties.description: Whether to use the default form popup when creating/modifying events.

properties.name: useDetailPopup
properties.description: Whether to use the default detail popup when clicking events.

properties.name: isReadOnly
properties.description: Whether the calendar is read-only.

properties.name: usageStatistics
properties.description:
Whether to allow collect hostname and send the information to google analytics.
For more information, check out the documentation.

properties.name: eventFilter
properties.description: A function that returns true if the event should be displayed. The default filter checks if the event's  property is true.

properties.name: week
properties.description: Week option of the calendar instance.

properties.name: startDayOfWeek
properties.description: Start day of the week. Available values are 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

properties.name: dayNames
properties.description:
Names of days of the week. Should be 7 items starting from Sunday to Saturday. If not specified, the default names are used.
Default values are 'Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'.

properties.name: workweek
properties.description: Whether to exclude Saturday and Sunday.

properties.name: showTimezoneCollapseButton
properties.description: Whether to show the timezone collapse button.

properties.name: timezonesCollapsed
properties.description: Whether to collapse the timezones.

properties.name: hourStart
properties.description: Start hour of the day. Available values are 0 to 24.

properties.name: hourEnd
properties.description: End hour of the day. Available values are 0 to 24. Must be greater than .

properties.name: narrowWeekend
properties.description: Whether to narrow down width of weekends to half.

properties.name: eventView
properties.description: Determine which view to display events. Available values are 'allday' and 'time'. set to  to disable event view.

properties.name: taskView
properties.description: Determine which view to display tasks. Available values are 'milestone' and 'task'. set to  to disable task view.

properties.name: month
properties.description: Month option of the calendar instance.

properties.name: startDayOfWeek
properties.description: Start day of the week. Available values are 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

properties.name: dayNames
properties.description:
Names of days of the week. Should be 7 items starting from Sunday to Saturday. If not specified, the default names are used.
Default values are 'Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'.

properties.name: workweek
properties.description: Whether to exclude Saturday and Sunday.

properties.name: narrowWeekend
properties.description: Whether to narrow down width of weekends to half.

properties.name: visibleWeeksCount
properties.description: Number of weeks to display. 0 means display all weeks.

properties.name: calendars
properties.description: Calendars to group events.

properties.name: gridSelection
properties.description: Whether to enable grid selection. or it's option. it's enabled when the value is  and object and will be disabled when  is true.

properties.name: enableDbClick
properties.description: Whether to enable double click to select area.

properties.name: enableClick
properties.description: Whether to enable click to select area.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: Timezone option of the calendar instance. For more information about timezone, check out the Options in guide.

properties.name: theme
properties.description: Theme option of the calendar instance. For more information, see Theme in guide.

properties.name: template
properties.description: Template option of the calendar instance. For more information, see Template in guide.

items.name: next()
items.description: Move the calendar forward to the next range.

examples.code: function moveToNextOrPrevRange(offset) { if (offset === -1) { calendar.prev(); } else if (offset === 1) { calendar.next(); } }

items.name: openFormPopup(event)
items.description: Open event form popup with predefined form values.

params.name: event
params.description: The predefined EventObject data to show in form.

items.name: prev()
items.description: Move the calendar backward to the previous range.

examples.code: function moveToNextOrPrevRange(offset) { if (offset === -1) { calendar.prev(); } else if (offset === 1) { calendar.next(); } }

items.name: render()
items.description: Render the calendar.

examples.code: calendar.render();
// Re-render the calendar when resizing a window. window.addEventListener('resize', () => { calendar.render(); });

items.name: renderToString()
items.description: For SSR(Server Side Rendering), Return the HTML string of the whole calendar.

items.name: scrollToNow(scrollBehavior)
items.description:
Scroll to current time on today in case of daily, weekly view.
Nothing happens in the monthly view.

examples.code: function onNewEvents(events) { calendar.createEvents(events); calendar.scrollToNow('smooth'); }

items.name: setCalendarColor(calendarId, colorOptions)
items.description: Change color values of events belong to a certain calendar.

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The calendar ID

params.name: colorOptions
params.description: The color values of the calendar

properties.name: color
properties.description: The text color of the events

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: Left border color of events

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Background color of events

properties.name: dragBackgroundColor
properties.description: Background color of events during dragging

examples.code: calendar.setCalendarColor('1', { color: '#e8e8e8', backgroundColor: '#585858', borderColor: '#a1b56c', dragBackgroundColor: '#585858', }); calendar.setCalendarColor('2', { color: '#282828', backgroundColor: '#dc9656', borderColor: '#a1b56c', dragBackgroundColor: '#dc9656', }); calendar.setCalendarColor('3', { color: '#a16946', backgroundColor: '#ab4642', borderColor: '#a1b56c', dragBackgroundColor: '#ab4642', });

items.name: setCalendars(calendars)
items.description: Set calendar list.

params.name: calendars
params.description: list of calendars

items.name: setCalendarVisibility(calendarId, isVisible)
items.description: Set events' visibility by calendar ID

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The calendar id or ids to change visibility

params.name: isVisible
params.description: If set to true, show the events. If set to false, hide the events.

items.name: setDate(date)
items.description: Move to specific date.

params.name: date
params.description: The date to move. it should be eligible parameter to create a  instance if  is string or number.

examples.code: calendar.on('clickDayName', (event) => { if (calendar.getViewName() === 'week') { const dateToMove = new Date(event.date); calendar.setDate(dateToMove); calendar.changeView('day'); } });

items.name: setOptions(options)
items.description: Set options of calendar. For more information, see Options in guide.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to set

items.name: setTheme(theme)
items.description: Set the theme of the calendar.

params.name: theme
params.description: The theme object to apply. For more information, see Theme in guide.

examples.code: calendar.setTheme({ common: { gridSelection: { backgroundColor: '#333', }, }, week: { nowIndicatorLabel: { color: '#00FF00', }, }, month: { dayName: { borderLeft: '1px solid #e5e5e5', }, }, });

items.name: today()
items.description: Move to today.

examples.code: function onClickTodayBtn() { calendar.today(); }

items.name: updateEvent(eventId, calendarId, changes)
items.description: Update an event.

params.name: eventId
params.description: ID of an event to update

params.name: calendarId
params.description: The calendarId of the event to update

params.name: changes
params.description: The new EventObject data to apply to the event

examples.code: calendar.on('beforeUpdateEvent', function ({ event, changes }) { const { id, calendarId } = event; calendar.updateEvent(id, calendarId, changes); });
